page.title: 19CLOUGHA ACCESS QUERNMORE
page.content: Quernmore and Littledale are in an area of outstanding natural beauty.A little while ago a car park and picnic area were built so that people could enjoy the countryside.It leads to the Clougha Access Area which is a path over the moors which people can walk on but it means they haven't to stray away from the path and they are not allowed to take dogs.During the grouse shooting season the access area is closed.Most of the moors are owned by the Duke of Westminster and he brings shooting parties from August 12th onwards. During the war it was a training ground for the army and there is a notice which says "Beware of unexploded shells.Do not touch.Report to Police." There haven't been any accidents in this area yet thank goodness.
